findings.summary: Duplicate branches in identifier extraction: len>=4 and len>=3 both use parts[-2]
evidence: Lines 111-117: if len(parts) >= 4: identifier = parts[-2] / elif len(parts) >= 3: identifier = parts[-2] — both branches are identical
findings.suggestion: Collapse into single branch: if len(parts) >= 3: identifier = parts[-2]
findings.reasoning: Dead logic branch that misleads readers into thinking the two cases differ

findings.summary: _finding_weight(f) called twice per sort comparison — compute once
findings.suggestion: Use walrus operator or pre-compute: key=lambda f: (w := _finding_weight(f)) and (-w[0], w[2])
findings.reasoning: Unnecessary double computation in sort key, easy to fix

findings.summary: Function name says 'or string context' but only checks comment lines, match_start param unused
evidence: Function accepts match_start parameter but never uses it; only checks if line starts with comment markers (#, //, *, /*)
findings.suggestion: Rename to _is_comment_line and remove unused match_start parameter
findings.reasoning: Name/behavior mismatch and unused parameter violate the function's stated contract

findings.summary: Pure alias _EXCLUDED_ZONES = EXCLUDED_ZONE_VALUES adds indirection without value
evidence: Line 48: _EXCLUDED_ZONES = EXCLUDED_ZONE_VALUES — imports and rebinds with no transformation
findings.suggestion: Use EXCLUDED_ZONE_VALUES directly at all call sites in scoring.py
findings.reasoning: Alias forces readers to check whether this is the same set or a different one
